programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Further exploration of 10-X uncovers an item that could potentially link the island to Ancient Rome.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters make uncertain journeys into dangerous areas of the swamp. Acting on a tip-off, one team heads to hostile waters that are believed to be cursed.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie calls in Jason's rotator to tackle a recovery in the Canyon and the Mission Towing team juggles a lost load of telephone poles.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is spellbound when a book signed by the great Harry Houdini appears in the shop. Meanwhile, Corey spots an old X-ray unit and Chum takes a vow of silence.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from the movie Cleopatra and a 1922 silver peace dollar make for an interesting day at the Gold and Silver pawn shop.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A look at the 1974 Coyame and 2007 Xilitla UFO crash cases in Mexico, where the Mexican and US military reportedly recovered wreckage material.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The January 2008 mass UFO sightings between Fort Worth, Texas and Houston, with focus on the nearby town of Stephenville, Texas.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with creating a signature Damascus blade out of three different steels of different thicknesses. The two final competitors re-create one of the most intricate weapons in history - the steel crossbow..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les shocks the others when he reveals his plans to buy a new store. Meanwhile, a man wanting to pawn his VCR causes a scene, and another tries to get money for his fake eye.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a medal with links to Captain Cook, and a putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational. Plus, Rick's stress levels hit a new high.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff examine items signed by President Franklin D Roosevelt, as well as a rare photograph taken during baseball star Babe Ruth's debut season.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An original sketch from a popular animation is brought into the shop, and Rick is offered what is believed to be a first edition of Richard Nixon's memoir.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Original artwork from the 1995 Batman-Spider-Man crossover comic shows up in the shop. Plus, Rick examines a deadly Revolutionary War halberd.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick has a big decision to make when a programme from the unveiling of the Statue of Liberty shows up. He also hits the road to check out a 1966 Chevy II.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed AC/DC album and a Beals Model Remington revolver give the team pause for thought. Plus, Rick searches for new ways to publicise the pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is spellbound when a book signed by the great Harry Houdini appears in the shop. Meanwhile, Corey spots an old X-ray unit and Chum takes a vow of silence.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from the movie Cleopatra and a 1922 silver peace dollar make for an interesting day at the Gold and Silver pawn shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Steve takes on the challenge of restoring a rusty 1978 Gran Torino to its former glory.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor tell the stories behind artefacts unearthed from former military sites across the UK. They also discover a tank buried in a vineyard.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor go in search of relics from the United States' elite 82nd airborne infantry division.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Apollo 11 mission to the moon and the suggestion that the moon is actually a giant spacecraft allowing extraterrestrials to monitor Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Russia spans over six million square miles of some of the most rugged terrain on Earth, much of which is uninhabited and largely unexplored. It is also the home of cosmism - a belief that human civilization originated in the cosmos.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with BBC Breakfast presenter Naga Munchetty and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Pointless co-host Richard Osman, broadcaster Joan Bakewell and comedian Roisin Conaty to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include Bambi, chewing gum and cobblers.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Kerry Godliman, Suzi Ruffell, Loyiso Gola
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Kerry Godliman, star of ITV's Bad Move and Taskmaster on Dave, comperes the comedy show at London's Hammersmith Apollo. She warms up the audience before introducing routines by the energetic Suzi Ruffell and South African comedian Loyiso Gola.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian steps out of the spotlight to learn another trade, trying his hand at the distinctly glamourless profession of farming - and his introduction to the job sees him mucking out the cows.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: The naturalist travels down the Baliem River in New Guinea from its source to the sea, hoping to encounter the ancient tribes and dangerous wildlife that live long its banks and in the surrounding jungle. He begins his journey inland at Lake Habbema, and braves some of the world's fiercest white water rapids. Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc and Chris Harris review the new Bentley Continental GT, while Chris also attempts to tame the scariest Porsche 911 of all time. Rory Reid test drives the new Renault Megane hot hatch, and Gregory Porter joins the team in the studio.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank stumble on a surprise find in a man-cave full of cars. They also encounter an eccentric seller who answers to an otherworldly power.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are feeling lucky as they head to the huge stockpile of a Kentucky collector who is desperate to sell his collection before his roof caves in.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: In California, Brandon and Lori are given a surprise in one of their storage unit lots.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori discover a dead cow in one of their storage unit lots.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon wins some spy equipment at an auction in Culver City.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse forges controversial alliances, while Sean uncovers an auction lot that has been used for a prank.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenter Claudia Winkleman, broadcaster Clive Anderson, comedian Jason Manford and comedienne Miranda Hart join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jack Whitehall and Frankie Boyle, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and journalist Kelvin MacKenzie join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Dave Gorman and Omid Djalili, TV presenter Davina McCall and journalist Janet Street-Porter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy determines that on no account will her plans for a surprise anniversary party for her parents be revealed. However, she then makes the big mistake of disclosing the details to Lee. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The friends' plans for a relaxing summer holiday don't get off to the best of starts when Lee gets a bad case of the jitters on the plane - and Lucy and Daisy have to endure the worst flight of their lives. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix, with Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee is worried that the woman of his dreams is drifting farther away - and admits his fears to Toby over a few drinks in the bar. Can his neighbour give him the advice he needs to win Lucy's heart once and for all? Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Hugh Dennis, with Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Laconic Yorkshireman Alun Cochrane, popular stand-up Ed Byrne and one-liner specialist Gary Delaney join Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for an October 2012 edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, hosted by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu and the boys are back on the road heading to Cardiff to cook for American stand-up and actor Desiree Burch, who is in the Welsh capital with her new show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Canadian comedienne Katherine Ryan, Radio 4 favourite Milton Jones and Stand Up for the Week's Josh Widdicombe join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison to offer a satirical take on current events. From 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedy writer and actor Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Conservative MP Nicky Morgan and comedian Jon Richardson joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The forgery of Hitler's diaries in the 1980s, which fooled several respected historians and news publications, and brought to light the thriving trade in Nazi memorabilia.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Documentary following the engineers and aviators who battle to keep the UK's most historic warplanes in the air. In the first edition, the team rebuild a Spitfire MJ772.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A team of engineers fight to return a veteran Westland Wessex helicopter to the skies - 30 years after its last flight.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingoes and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species' behaviour in similar ways.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of humans and animals over the course of a year in Alaska, which is by far the biggest US state and still one of the wildest places on Earth with deep forests and vast mountain ranges. The arrival of spring sees Alaska go through a huge transformation as water, light and warmth return, with animals emerging from hibernation and rushing to cash in on the riches of the season. Dougray Scott narrates.

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: The land is bathed in 24-hour sunlight during the short Alaskan summer, luring hummingbirds up from Mexico, exposing deserts in the Arctic and relying on parachuting firefighters to tackle forest fires in its vast wilderness. Grizzly bears fatten up on a sudden wealth of salmon, a caribou calf joins a vast herd on its great migration and a huge male moose finds unlikely ways to impress a female. Among the human population, a dedicated grower of giant vegetables takes his half-ton pumpkin to the Alaska State Fair.

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: To survive the bone-chilling cold, deadly blizzards and darkness of the eight months of an Alaskan winter takes courage, cunning and remarkable endurance. This episode tells the stories of how the tough and resourceful animal and human inhabitants of the windswept mountain peaks, icy tundra and snowbound forests face up to the challenges of the season.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Creatures that live in volcanic hot spots on the ocean bed, areas that reach temperatures hot enough to melt lead and which may hold the secrets behind all life on Earth. Other strange creatures from the depths of the sea include bone-eating worms, fish that walk rather than swim, and hordes of squid. Plus, footage of sharks in a feeding frenzy over the dead body of a whale and the wildlife of the Midnight Zone in the Pacific, an area that never receives any natural light, forcing creatures to rely on their own bioluminescence.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Highclere Castle, the setting used for TV drama Downton Abbey, including an insight into the lives of current residents Lord and Lady Carnarvon.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden history of the stately home in Derbyshire, the residence of the dukes of Devonshire, revealing tales of intrigue, tragedy and scandal.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn rides up Mount Snowdon's railway to visit the summit station, and discovers how a glass structure envelopes Strasbourg's 19th-century station.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: A marine biologist and a deep-sea diver explore Chuuk Lagoon, one of the world's greatest underwater graveyards, for a wreck discovered by sonar nearly 20 years ago.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is approached by a group of survivors from a recent train crash, who want the members to uncover the reasons for the disaster. In the process investigators stumble upon another mystery, when one of the bodies pulled from the wreckage remains unidentified. With Emilia Fox, William Gaminara, Tom Ward, Amita Dhiri and Emma Cunniffe.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir has a chip on his shoulder about Mickey Webb's return to Sun Hill, refusing to work with Jack Meadows' blue-eyed boy, but he soon learns to appreciate his off-the-record policing skills. Honey and Amber are put under the microscope as appraisals loom and come through covered in glory, but Gina Gold upsets the entire team by introducing a 12-hour shift rota.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George and Pearce make a gruesome discovery in an empty flat, and Blue Watch attend a massive fire at a hospital. Starring Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy and Ruth try to patch up a local pig farmer's marriage, while Stephen receives his exam results and faces the prospect of leaving town for good. The Skelthwaite Scorpions take on sworn enemies the Hoxton Giants, and for Vic it promises to be the match of a lifetime. Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Sarah Lancashire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy argues with Ruth after Vic comes a cropper in Simon's factory, and later comforts Mary Cooper as she tries to come to terms with the death of her husband. Meanwhile, Stephen returns home. Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Three Men and a Brittle Lady
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer offers to track down a conman after Charlie is swindled out of a china figurine. He also helps Charlotte find the thieves who've robbed her house. Drama, guest starring Lionel Jeffries and Eve Matheson.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer falls under the suspicion of an ambitious and ruthless police officer, who suspects he is handling stolen European furniture. Meanwhile, Tinker joins Eric for a brief holiday in Essex, where they soon become involved in a smuggling racket. Warren Mitchell and Reece Dinsdale guest star, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: The treacherous Major Brand attempts to dupe Sharpe into helping him betray Ross to the French, while back behind British lines Jane has to deal with the amorous advances of a poet. Sean Bean stars, with Daragh O'Malley, Mark Strong and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Lu and Frank try to exonerate local criminal Billy the Brick when the local mayor is murdered in the dead of night. Comedy drama, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The coppers investigate the discovery of a body unearthed during renovations at a new university, and are left puzzling over blackmail, mistaken identity and possible suicide. Feature-length detective drama, with Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Prunella Scales.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Newlyweds Ellie and Pascoe leave for their honeymoon, so Dalziel decides to take a break of his own in East Anglia. Inevitably, peace is the last thing on the menu as he indulges in a passionate fling with a local widow and uncovers all manner of scurrilous goings-on involving her troubled family. Crime drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Francesca Annis and Susannah Corbett.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Return of the detective drama. Mike and his team are drawn into a world of Victorian dress-up and escapism when they investigate a murder at a Brokenwood steampunk event.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A former music hall comedian swears revenge on the priest, leaving Father Brown trapped in a derelict building. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The arrival of two former colleagues from Manchester antagonises Gene, who refuses to believe their claim they have pursued a retired stand-up comedian to London because he stole from the Police Widows' Fund. As the hunt turns competitive, it becomes clear the suspect is terrified - and when gunshots ring out, the team realises why. However, further complications arise after the visitors make it clear to Alex they have information about Sam Tyler's death.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Viv is taken hostage during a prison riot, prompting Ray and Chris to go undercover to free him - but the violent criminal leading the revolt soon recognises them as police, leaving three officers in danger. Alex hopes catching a convict who escaped during the crisis will help, but he leaves her more unsettled than ever by insisting they have met before. Stanley Townsend (Rough Diamond) guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for the Bond Bug, a three-wheeled 1970s British sports car, hoping that if he can acquire one his expert mechanic Edd China can make it roadworthy once more.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Michigan, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a 1985 Cadillac, but what they really want is a pump. Then, they're shown a barn-fresh 1931 Ford Model A tow truck that is so rare it could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jr cracks out the chrome for the chopper - and it's looking good. Mikey wants to prove a point on the racetrack, but has to keep up with the pace guy.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Doug is sent on a mission to deliver volatile explosives to the island of St Lawrence, while in Unk, Ben has a shock when he crashes into a large bird mid-flight.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unappealing tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The techniques involved in making jawbreaker gobstoppers, drum shells and engine blocks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The evolving techniques used in the making of lighters, hockey pucks and high-pressure cylinders.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: Michael flies an old Russian Antonov from Germany to America, an incredible journey of 6,500km, without radar, in what could be his most dangerous mission yet.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: A look at the Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: The lives of those people associated with Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many, it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rust-free Triumph TR6 sports car from the 1970s that he wants to restore, but first mechanic Edd China has to rebuild the engine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a TVR Cerbera for £8,000, and Edd China works on restoring this classic sports car so it may be sold on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China tries to renovate a Triumph Spitfire sports car so Mike Brewer can sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues to renovate the Triumph Spitfire, replacing the differential and rear shock absorbers and having the bumpers and handles chromed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a 1957 Thunderbird, marketed as one of the world's first luxury cars, which sold healthily in its day.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: After purchasing a badly modified DeSoto Firedome, Mike Brewer and Edd China set about addressing the damage to give the stunning cruiser back some of its class.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The team's morning banter is interrupted by a retired Airbus A320 arriving from Estonia. Plus, an unusual request comes in from a diving instructor for a highly durable item.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen combat opal thieves on land and in the skies. Plus, Lightning Ridge's Gavan McFarlane puts his son to work and the Boulder Boys dig their way out of trouble.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tries to track down an early SUV - a 1970 International Harvester Scout 800A. Ant's repair includes rebuilding a leaky transfer case and replacing the interior.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard browses a salvage fair by Ripley Castle, North Yorkshire. In Newcastle, he visits a dealer of mid-20th century designer furniture and later checks out an art collection in Hastings, East Sussex.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part three of three. Henry Cole faces his biggest challenge yet - crossing the infamous Nullabor Plain, some 2,000kms of nothing.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen combat opal thieves on land and in the skies. Plus, Lightning Ridge's Gavan McFarlane puts his son to work and the Boulder Boys dig their way out of trouble.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: George and Scott head back to Ghana, $1million in debt and determined to find gold, but they face a host of pitfalls while trying to get the operation back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Detectives suspect arson upon investigating the raging fire that turned a couple's home into a death chamber. Plus, officers employ the services of a special type of sniffer dog to track down a missing target.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Red Jacket
programme.desc: On Valentine's night 2015, 27-year-old James Enright was stabbed to death near a station in Burnaby, Canada. Police were heped in their inquiries after discovering the incident had been captured on a phone camera.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Kelly Eckart, an 18-year-old who disappeared after finishing her shift at an Indiana hardware store in September 1997. Her car was discovered abandoned by the side of the road still running, and four days later her partially naked body was found in a ravine. Workman Michael Overstreet was eventually convicted of the crime after eyewitnesses reported seeing him in the area and DNA evidence provided a solid link.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How greed motivated the Prince brothers to kill, firstly for money and then to get rid of those who could testify against them.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A man is caught on camera abusing a dog, and a horse needs help after collapsing.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown and Lisa Chimes head out to the Blue Mountains after some of the most intense bushfires on record, to help pets and wildlife in the fire zone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride searching for modest bridesmaid dresses falls in love with a revealing gown that reduces her mother to tears.
